data.title: Simple but delicious
data.text: Finally a place with great calzones in Central Texas! The menu is very simple for Italian but we've yet to be disappointed. We live nearby and eat out almost every meal so we've tried everywhere from New Braunfels to Temple and back looking for great restaurants. The only thing lacking is that they don't have appetizers but it won't keep us away.

data.title: Yay! They are cooking pizzas again!
data.text: Cooler weather has allowed them to add pizza to the menu so we tried it. Very good! Had a mushroom, pepperoni, ricotta and mozzarella pizza-yum!! We were already addicted to the pasta with gorgonzola cream sauce with red peppers and chicken.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Little, unassuming place, easy to miss even walking right by. If you do, stop, turn around, go in and eat. Fresh homemade pasta and bread, a terrific Italian dressing on a big fresh cut salad. Service is quick and unobtrusive, decor is plain, one of the best real Italian places in the entire Austin area. If you dropped this place into the middle of Bologna, Italy it would fit right in. Highly recommended!

data.title: Homemade Pasta / Calzones
data.text: Great fresh entrees; homemade pastas and calzones, my favorite is the Rustica with Cherry peppers added.  The calzone is one of the largest I have every seen.  The salads are fresh and large enough to share.  Everything is homemade and very fresh!

data.title: Wow- knock your socks off Italian
data.text:
We all shared the spinach salad, fettacini palermo, calzone, ravioli, spaghetti, and one other pasta dish.

All perfect.

Get there early! It fills up fast.
Great service too

data.title: Not Impressed
data.text: We really wanted to like this place, but it was nothing special. My wife's pasta was mushy and I had a call one that came with such a small amount of red sauce that you would think it was gold. Too bad.

data.title: Best date night
data.text: Best Italian dish I have ever had the tagettelli de suga OMG soooo good you have to have this. All the food here is amazing and it's never expensive. We usually have 3 courses for about 40 with beer and wine. Do make reservations !

data.title: Hit and Miss
data.text: Went on a Sunday after church, arrived before they opened at 1 so walked around downtown and past their open door where the smell of something burning was strong.  When we returned we were told to seat ourselves, there were 2 tables already occupied and a table of 8 came in after us.  They only had one waiter which was the first "miss".  We ordered and had to wait a long time.  There was no bread offered while we waited, saw others order antipasto plates that looked good. I read good reviews of the short ribs, unfortunately mine were dry and stringy.  The fresh pasta and sauce were very good.  The calzone was huge, but not very flavorful.  The lasagna was wonderful.  The pasta carbonara disclosed where the "burned" smell from earlier came from, the pancetta was overdone and tasted burned.  I saw the meatballs at another table and they were huge.  I will give this place another try

data.title: Fresh! Hot! Delicious!
data.text: We've been searching the Austin area for a good "spaghetti and wine" place - something that is NOT a chain.  I think we just found it.  The thing that hit me first when walking into  the Palermo Pasta House on historic Main Street in Round Rock was the tantalizing smell.  Pasta is made fresh daily, sauce to pasta ratio was great - it wasn't drowning in sauce and it was not dry and needing more sauce - like so many of the chain Italian places.  Service was prompt and personable - not overly pushy.  wine list is small, but good. meatballs were hot and fresh,  pasta was delicious and the salad was fresh (side salad - have the house dressing).   After the smells that lure you inside - I was not disappointed.  Thinking about what I want to try on our next visit (pizza? calzone?)

data.title: A Finr Pasta House
data.text: Palermo's offers a nice experience in Italian dinning. The food was very good, the service was ok, but could be better. In general, we had a good time and enjoyed the food. We will go again.

data.title: Cute little restaurant
data.text: Simple basic pastas.  Good, made fresh daily.   Don't expect lots of variety.  Summertime they don't make pizza but will make yummy calzones.

data.title: Best pasta in Round Rock area
data.text: Joined another couple at Palermo last night for an early dinner. Had fresh made tagliatelle noodles with a gorgonzolla cream sauce. Incredible! Best noodles ever eaten.  Both husbands had spaghetti with meatballs which they loved.  Other wife had a huge calzone full of meat and cheese. New favorite Italian restaurant in Austin metro area. Only negative is no vegetable side dishes. Need to  add some broccoli, green beans, Brussels sprouts, etc.

data.title: Only the ambiance keeps it from a 5!
data.text: This tiny restaurant in a square room in the middle of the block serves REALLY good food. The pasta is all homemade and the accompanying food deserves an applause. I would have liked my chicken with red peppers and mushrooms to have been a little less minced but the taste was fabulous. My husband had short ribs and they were juicy  not stringy and fell off the bone-I almost didn't give it back after my taste. The wine was delicious and fairly priced. The place also serves pizza that looked inviting. We'll go back despite the bright overhead lights and lack of decor and just not expect a romantic Italian dinner. Candles on the table, lower the lights and a few tall ferns would go miles towards improvement.

data.title: Good food, not so good food, but overall was a good experience.
data.text:
Palermo Pasta House has some very good points and some not so good points.    We went early on  a Friday night so we were seated quickly.  However, the place is small and can get busy.  I heard the wait staff recommend reservations to customers who came in once it got busy.   So make a reservation.

The food was hit and miss.  It all looked awesome.  I ordered the Veal Short Ribs.  These were tender and incredible.  I definitely recommend them.   I also ordered a side of meatballs because meatballs are an easy way to judge Italian food and I like meatballs.   The meatballs were delicious.    My partner ordered the cannelloni and it was awful.  It was dry, overcooked, and no sauce.   The bread was just OK even though it's made on premises (I think).

The service seemed to be hit or miss.   Our waiter barely had time to say hello much less make recommendations before rushing off.   Other tables got 10 minutes conversations from their wait person.  So I guess that if you go regularly you get better service.    Also the tables are close together so when we were eating, we got a face full of waiter butt as she took orders at the table next to us.   The wait staff should pay attention to their surroundings.

The atmosphere is really cool.  The food overall was ok.  I think that I'll go back.   But nothing was spectacular here.

data.title: Excellent Italian food!
data.text:
I've been to this place three times now, and the food is consistently high quality and well-prepared.  The appetizer salads are spectacular -- very fresh ingredients.  And if you've never had fresh-made pasta, this is the place to try it.  The sauces are also very good.  When we were here this past weekend, I tried the pizza for the first time and it was also excellent -- just the right amount of sauce and cheese and a very nice crust.  

The service is fair.  I've been there when it was excellent, and when it was mediocre - so I guess it depends on who your server is.  

My only complaint is that you must have to get there early to enjoy the specials of the day, because every time Ive gone they are out of most of the daily specials.

data.title: Walk in dinner.   Make a reservation
data.text: We both had fettuccini.  I did a capresse  salad with a small plate of pasta.  Perfect for me.  Delicious white sauce and wonderful homemade bread.   My husband had the Palermo fettuccine and said it was delicious.  Around us folks were enjoying pizzas and huge calzones.   The folks working were awesome.  There are only 12 tables.   Next to Main Street Restaurant.  The sign isn't lit and hard to see.   Enjoyed it.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text: Came for dinner at 6:30 on a Saturday night and were seated right away.  We had the appetizer plate which included a generous portion of olives, cheese,  meats, bread, and nuts.   Everything was fresh and delicious. We then had the pasta and a pizza and both were amazing.   The price was right as well.   We'll be back.

data.title: Wonderful Food, Manager ......make a reservation!
data.text:
My daughter and I just stopped by for a spur of the moment dinner. We had seen mixed reviews but always like to make up our own minds. 
First let me say the food was absolutely delicious, the pasta was obviously fresh and handmade. My daughter's calzone was huge and stuffed so full of cheese and the other ingredients that when you cut it open it oozed cheese all over the plate, absolutely wonderful. 
Our server was friendly and very attentive. But, we walked into the restaurant a little bit before 6 PM, the manager immediately asked us if we had a reservation even though there were only three other tables that had people sitting at them. He then went ahead and told us that it's always better to have a reservation because this is their busiest time and that they can never guarantee us a place to sit. I appreciated the fact that we might have needed a reservation and we were prepared to not be able to eat there. But, the condescending overly self-important attitude of the host/manager was irritating. Considering he felt it was such an upscale place that everyone needed to make a reservation I was quite surprised when he just pointed at a table and told us to go sit there. He did this to everybody that came in. Most of whom did not have reservations. When we left at 8 pm half the tables were still empty. 
We were getting ready to go, our leftovers were in boxes, he came by and asked us if we wanted a bag for food and we said yes, he then proceeded to toss a bag into the middle of our table for us to put our own food in to. I'm perfectly happy to put my food in a bag, but if you're going to put yourself out there as a fine dining restaurant you at least need to treat your customers like you want them back. Making a reservation does not make a person likely to spend more money or make them a more important member of society. This really rubbed me the wrong way, he also may or may not have realized there were owners of a neighboring restaurant in eating. 
I am speaking only about the manager, our server was delightful, the food was wonderful and I would say it was a fine dining experience, we will definitely go back, I'm not sure if we will make a reservation.

data.title: Great service, great pizza!
data.text: Small, you need a reservation for peak times, we went a little early on a Fri. night, 6:00, and got in no problem. Delicious pizza! Server was helpful, courteous. Price was good for what seemed like a "made from scratch" pizza. Nice decor.

data.title: Not Good
data.text:
We tried a pizza and pasta with cream sauce.

The cream sauce was bland, and the spicy three meat pizza was way overpowered with hot peppers. I told our server that the pizza was too spicy and she apologized, but did not offer to have it remade. I would not recommend.
